2.2.1.revertHardeningScript: REM No default accounts assigned, so nothing to revert

2.2.11.revertHardeningScript: REM No default accounts assigned, so nothing to revert

2.2.12.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators +r SeCreateGlobalPrivilege & ntrights -u "LOCAL SERVICE" +r SeCreateGlobalPrivilege & ntrights -u "NETWORK SERVICE" +r SeCreateGlobalPrivilege & ntrights -u SERVICE +r SeCreateGlobalPrivilege

2.2.13.revertHardeningScript: REM No default accounts assigned, so nothing to revert

2.2.14.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators +r SeCreateSymbolicLinkPrivilege & ntrights -u "NT VIRTUAL MACHINE\Virtual Machines" +r SeCreateSymbolicLinkPrivilege

2.2.15.revertHardeningScript: REM Default accounts already have this right; no revert required

2.2.16.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove Guests from SeDenyNetworkLogonRight if needed

2.2.17.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove Guests from SeDenyBatchLogonRight if needed

2.2.18.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove Guests from SeDenyServiceLogonRight if needed

2.2.19.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove Guests from SeDenyInteractiveLogonRight if needed

2.2.2.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators +r SeNetworkLogonRight & ntrights -u "Remote Desktop Users" +r SeNetworkLogonRight
2.2.2.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove Administrators or Remote Desktop Users from SeNetworkLogonRight if needed

2.2.20.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove Guests from SeDenyRemoteInteractiveLogonRight if needed

2.2.21.hardeningScript: REM No action needed as default is 'No One' for SeEnableDelegationPrivilege
2.2.21.revertHardeningScript: REM This is default behavior; no revert required

2.2.22.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove Administrators from SeRemoteShutdownPrivilege if needed

2.2.23.hardeningScript: ntrights -u "LOCAL SERVICE" +r SeAuditPrivilege & ntrights -u "NETWORK SERVICE" +r SeAuditPrivilege
2.2.23.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove LOCAL SERVICE and NETWORK SERVICE from SeAuditPrivilege if needed

2.2.24.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators +r SeImpersonatePrivilege & ntrights -u "LOCAL SERVICE" +r SeImpersonatePrivilege & ntrights -u "NETWORK SERVICE" +r SeImpersonatePrivilege & ntrights -u SERVICE +r SeImpersonatePrivilege
2.2.24.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove users from SeImpersonatePrivilege if needed

2.2.25.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators +r SeIncreaseBasePriorityPrivilege & ntrights -u "Window Manager\Window Manager Group" +r SeIncreaseBasePriorityPrivilege
2.2.25.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove users from SeIncreaseBasePriorityPrivilege if needed

2.2.26.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove Administrators from SeLoadDriverPrivilege if needed

2.2.27.revertHardeningScript: REM Restore Users to SeRemoteInteractiveLogonRight if needed

2.2.28.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove Administrators from SeBackupPrivilege if needed

2.2.29.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove Administrators from SeRestorePrivilege if needed

2.2.3.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators -r SeTcbPrivilege && ntrights -u Users -r SeTcbPrivilege
2.2.3.revertHardeningScript: REM Reverting this setting should be done manually if required, as default usually grants this right only to SYSTEM

2.2.30.revertHardeningScript: REM Restore Users to SeChangeNotifyPrivilege if needed

2.2.31.revertHardeningScript: REM Restore default assignment for SeReLabelPrivilege if needed

2.2.32.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove Administrators from SeSystemEnvironmentPrivilege if needed

2.2.33.revertHardeningScript: REM Remove Administrators from SeManageVolumePrivilege if needed

2.2.35.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators +r SeSystemProfilePrivilege && ntrights -u "NT SERVICE\WdiServiceHost" +r SeSystemProfilePrivilege
2.2.35.revertHardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators -r SeSystemProfilePrivilege && ntrights -u "NT SERVICE\WdiServiceHost" -r SeSystemProfilePrivilege

2.2.36.hardeningScript: ntrights -u "LOCAL SERVICE" +r SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege && ntrights -u "NETWORK SERVICE" +r SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege
2.2.36.revertHardeningScript: ntrights -u "LOCAL SERVICE" -r SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege && ntrights -u "NETWORK SERVICE" -r SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege

2.2.38.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators +r SeShutdownPrivilege && ntrights -u Users +r SeShutdownPrivilege
2.2.38.revertHardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators -r SeShutdownPrivilege && ntrights -u Users -r SeShutdownPrivilege

2.2.4.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators +r SeIncreaseQuotaPrivilege && ntrights -u "LOCAL SERVICE" +r SeIncreaseQuotaPrivilege && ntrights -u "NETWORK SERVICE" +r SeIncreaseQuotaPrivilege
2.2.4.revertHardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators -r SeIncreaseQuotaPrivilege && ntrights -u "LOCAL SERVICE" -r SeIncreaseQuotaPrivilege && ntrights -u "NETWORK SERVICE" -r SeIncreaseQuotaPrivilege

2.2.5.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators +r SeInteractiveLogonRight && ntrights -u Users +r SeInteractiveLogonRight
2.2.5.revertHardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators -r SeInteractiveLogonRight && ntrights -u Users -r SeInteractiveLogonRight

2.2.6.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators +r SeRemoteInteractiveLogonRight && ntrights -u "Remote Desktop Users" +r SeRemoteInteractiveLogonRight
2.2.6.revertHardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators -r SeRemoteInteractiveLogonRight && ntrights -u "Remote Desktop Users" -r SeRemoteInteractiveLogonRight

2.2.8.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators +r SeSystemTimePrivilege && ntrights -u "LOCAL SERVICE" +r SeSystemTimePrivilege
2.2.8.revertHardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators -r SeSystemTimePrivilege && ntrights -u "LOCAL SERVICE" -r SeSystemTimePrivilege

2.2.9.hardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators +r SeTimeZonePrivilege && ntrights -u "LOCAL SERVICE" +r SeTimeZonePrivilege && ntrights -u Users +r SeTimeZonePrivilege
2.2.9.revertHardeningScript: ntrights -u Administrators -r SeTimeZonePrivilege && ntrights -u "LOCAL SERVICE" -r SeTimeZonePrivilege && ntrights -u Users -r SeTimeZonePrivilege

2.3.1.3.auditScript: wmic useraccount where name='Administrator' get name

2.3.1.4.auditScript: wmic useraccount where name='Guest' get name

2.3.7.5.hardeningScript: reg add "HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System" /v LegalNoticeText /t REG_SZ /d "All activities performed on this system will be monitored." /f
2.3.7.5.auditScript: reg query "HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System" /v LegalNoticeText | findstr /C:"All activities performed on this system will be monitored."
